body:
### Problem

Neovim crashes when subjected to a very long line in the terminal when 'number' is set. I found this while grepping and having the misfortune of matching minified javascript.

Context (libvterm src/screen.c):

```
(gdb) list
660	  }
661	
662	  /* We really expect the cursor position to be set by now */
663	  if(active && (new_cursor.row == -1 || new_cursor.col == -1)) {
664	    fprintf(stderr, "screen_resize failed to update cursor position\n");
665	    abort();
666	  }
667	
668	  if(old_row >= 0 && bufidx == BUFIDX_PRIMARY) {
669	    /* Push spare lines to scrollback buffer */
```

### Steps to reproduce

In your neovim checkout:

```
VIMRUNTIME=./runtime ./build/bin/nvim --clean --cmd 'set number' -c 'term bash'
```

then paste:

```
head -c 1000000 < /dev/zero | tr '\0' 'a'
```

into the terminal.

### Expected behavior

Should at least not crash. I don't care that much about a giant line being displayed properly, but currently it crashes, which is annoying.

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

46402c16c0c38701469c52fb28d16f2483cc7a72

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

unsurprisingly, no, 9.0.1882

### Operating system/version

Arch Linux

### Terminal name/version

alacritty 0.12.2 (9d9982df)

### $TERM environment variable

alacritty

### Installation

reproduces in a git checkout
